body: I’m thinking of adopting a #pet, but I can’t decide what kind! #petadoption #animallover
question: Help me out: What kind of pet should I adopt?

comments.body: Definitely a dog! They’re loyal and great companions. Plus, they give you a reason to get outside and exercise.
@34343 That’s what I’ve been leaning towards! But I’m a little worried about all the time they need for walks and attention.
@23232 Yeah, they do need a lot of time, but the bond is so worth it. If you have the time, go for it!
Cats all the way! They’re more independent, and you don’t have to take them for walks. Plus, they’re great for cuddles when they feel like it.
@45454 That’s true! Cats seem much lower maintenance, but I’ve never had one before. Are they hard to take care of?
@23232 Not really! Just make sure they have food, water, and a clean litter box, and they’re happy. Super easy compared to dogs.
I voted for bird! They’re fun to watch, and some of them can even talk. But they do need a bit of extra attention when it comes to cleaning the cage.
@56565 I hadn’t even considered birds, but that’s a good point! Do you think they get lonely if they’re in a cage most of the time?
@23232 Some birds do, especially the more social ones. You’d need to spend time with them or maybe even get a second bird to keep them company.
Fish are a great option if you’re looking for something lower maintenance! They’re calming to watch, and you don’t have to worry about walks or messes.
@67676 That’s true! Fish seem like a good option if I’m busy. Do they require a lot of upkeep with the tank?
@23232 Not too much, but you’ll need to clean the tank regularly and check the water quality. Once you get a routine, it’s pretty easy.
